core_themes.description: Analyses on internal armed conflicts, causes, dynamics, and impacts on economies and societies.
Studies on the relationship between defence spending and macroeconomic performance, including growth, debt, and inflation.
Economic perspectives on terrorism, including impacts, counterterror strategies, and group behaviour.
Examination of national defence policies, strategic planning, and defence governance structures.
Research on military labour markets, conscription vs. volunteer forces, and human capital issues.
Theoretical and empirical models explaining variations in military spending across countries and time.
Broader security-related economics, e.g. geopolitical risk, sanctions, piracy, and transnational policing.
Industry-level analysis of defence manufacturers, R&D, market structures, and industrial policy.

core_themes.theme: Fiscal (& Budgetary) Effects of Defence Spending
core_themes.description: Studies on how military spending affects public finances, deficits, and tax burdens.
Research on competitive military buildups, treaties, disarmament dynamics and strategic equilibria.

other_notable_themes.description: Analyses of alliance burden-sharing, public goods models of NATO, and alliance stability.
The economics of innovation in the defence sector, including technological change and procurement.
Studies on the trade, supply chains, and regulatory dynamics of international arms markets.
In-depth economic reviews of defence sectors in specific countries.
Spatial distribution and local economic impact of defence spending and installations.
Case studies of major defence firms (e.g., BAE Systems, Finmeccanica) and their market behaviour.
Analyses of UN and non-UN peacekeeping missions, costs, outcomes, and deployment patterns.
The application of public choice theory to defence decision-making and lobbying.

emerging_themes.description: Exploring links between environmental change, conflict, migration, and defence readiness.
Economic analysis of the role and regulation of private security providers.
Economics of information warfare, surveillance, and cyber-deterrence.
Resource allocation, ethics, and procurement challenges in AI-driven military tech.

emerging_themes.theme: Spatial Economics of Conflict and Terrorism
emerging_themes.description: Using spatial econometrics to examine how geography influences conflict patterns.
